sect2.title: Getting started
sect2.para:
This section describes the required steps to create your first automated GUI test for RCE using the RCP testing tools (RCPTT):
Download RCPTT for the respective platform from http://www.eclipse.org/rcptt/download/
Please note that you have to use an RCE release or snapshot built after July 2nd 2015. For the time being a snapshot can be downloaded here: http://updates-external.sc.dlr.de/rce/6.x/products/standard/snapshots/trunk/zip/
TODO: Remove this remark once the latest RCE release contains the respective fix.
Check out dev_config.ini file somewhere on your file system. It can be found here: de.rcenvironment\eclipse\launch\installation_data\dev_config.ini
Now you can start RCPTT and add RCE as an application under test (AUT). Therefore right click somewhere in the "Applications" view at the bottom and select "New...". Via "Browse..." you can navigate to RCE's installation folder, i.e. the folder that contains the rce executable. When RCPTT identifies RCE the name is automatically inserted, but can be replaced by a more convenient one. Click "Finish" to complete the dialog.
To allow RCPTT to start RCE the config.ini has to be set. Therefore right click on the application you just added in the "Applications" view and select "Configure...". In the following dialog, click "Advanced..." on the right hand side. In the just opened window browse to the "Configuration" tab. Here in the second group "Configuration File" you can select a config.ini that should be used. Select "Use an existing config.ini file as a template" and point to the respective location there you checked out the dev_config.ini from the RCE repository. Confirm the configuration window with "OK".
To check out whether RCE can be started, right click on the application and select "Run". If RCE starts, you can start to create your own test cases

In principle the creation of test cases is the same for every RCP based application. Therefore RCPTT's "Getting Started" guide which uses the Eclipse IDE as application under test is a good reference. The ideas presented here can easily be adapted to RCE's context. You can find it here: https://www.eclipse.org/rcptt/documentation/userguide/getstarted/
